actions.text: Read second time and referred to Senate Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Separation of Powers.
Subcommittee on Separation of Powers. Hearings held.

official_title: A bill to secure the right of students entitled to equal protection of the laws to be free from purposeful discrimination and segregation and to be treated in a racially neutral manner with regard to their assignment to public schools providing free public education, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Racially Neutral School Assignment Act - Declares that no student shall be denied the right to: (1) be free from purposeful segregation and discrimination by school authorities in his or her assignment to a public school; and (2) have his or her assignment to a public school determined in a racially neutral manner. Authorizes aggrieved persons and the Attorney General to bring actions in Federal court for violations of this Act.
